conclusion: Use properties of ideal gas and first law of thermodynamics
First law of thermodynamics: ΔU = Q - W
Internal energy U is a function of temperature for ideal gas
Change in internal energy ΔU = nC_V ΔT
Pressure in state A is p_A = p_0 and temperature T_A = T_0
Line segment AB is parallel to V axis, volume is constant
Work done from A to B is W_AB = p ΔV, ΔV = 0, so W_AB = 0
Problem states work done from A to B is 10 J, work is negative
W_AB = -10 J
Line segment BC is over the origin, process from B to C is isothermal
Work done in isothermal process: W_BC = nRT_0 ln(V_C/V_B)
Work done in isothermal process: W_BC = nR T_0 ln(V_C/V_B)
Need to find heat added during process from A to B
First law of thermodynamics: ΔU = Q - W
Process from A to B is isobaric, work done is W_AB = p_A ΔV
Volume in state B is twice volume in state A, V_B = 2V_A
W_AB = p_0 ΔV = p_0 (V_B - V_A) = p_0 V_A
Change in temperature ΔT = T_B - T_A = 2T_0 - T_0 = T_0
ΔU = nC_V T_0
Heat added Q = ΔU + W
Substitute W = -10 J and ΔU = nC_V T_0, Q = nC_V T_0 - 10 J
nC_V T_0 = 10 J
